author: Haula Galadima, Cormac Doherty, Rob Brennan

description.undefined: An ontology for modeling cybersecurity incident response processes

creator.value: Haula Galadima, Cormac Doherty, Rob Brennan

comment.undefined: Senior analyst or subject matter expert handling complex investigations.
A specific action taken or observed within a security event.
Incident responder handling deeper investigation and analysis.
First responder performing initial triage and categorization.
A planned response action to a security incident.
A security analyst who investigates and responds to incidents.
The analysis of observables from security events leading to an incident
A security incident that requires investigation and response.
Actions to limit the spread and impact of an incident.
Actions to restore systems to normal operation.
Communication between incident responders during an investigation.
Activities conducted after incident resolution (e.g., lessons learned, reporting).
Activities to assess security incidents.
Actions to remove threats and root causes from affected systems.
Activities in detection of security incidents.
An observable occurrence relevant to system security (e.g., alert from SIEM, IDS).
An observable piece of evidence collected from an incident.
Indicates association with an incident
Detailed findings from the analysis.
Links a security analysis to the analyst who performed it.
Title of the incident.
Timestamp when the security analysis was performed.
Inverse of hasCoaCreationAnalyst. Links an analyst to the courses of action they created.
Inverse of hasArtefactCreationAnalyst. Links an analyst to the artefacts they created.
Current execution status of the course of action.
Inverse of hasAnalysis. Links an analysis back to its incident.
Inverse of prov:wasGeneratedBy. Indicates a security event generated an analysis.
Inverse of hasCoa. Links a course of action back to its incident.
Timestamp when the course of action was created.
Narrative description of the course of action and its intended effect.
Timestamp when the incident was confirmed
Inverse of hasChatAnalyst. Links an analyst to the chat they generated.
Inverse of hasCoaAssignedAnalyst. Links an analyst to the courses of action they are assigned to execute.
Unique identifier for an analyst.
Timestamp when execution of the course of action was completed.
The severity level of an incident (Low, Medium, High, Critical).
Timestamp when incident response was formally concluded.
The sentiment or tone of the communication.
Inverse of hasConfirmationAnalyst. Links an analyst to the incidents they confirmed.
Email address of the analyst.
Links a course of action to the analyst who created or planned it.
Timestamp when the incident record was first created.
Links an incident to the security analyses performed on it.
Inverse of pertainsToIncident. Links an incident to a chat about it.
The content or body of the communication message.
Detailed description of the security event.
Timestamp when the artefact was collected.
Description of the specific activity within a security event.
Inverse of hasEvent. Links a security event back to its parent incident.
Indicates that a course of action used specific analysis
Inverse of prov:used. Indicates an analysis was used by a course of action.
Links an incident to one or more related security events that triggered or are part of it.
Inverse of prov:wasAssociatedWith. Indicates an incident had an associated entity.
Links a communication to the analyst who made the chat.
Timestamp when execution of the course of action was initiated.
Classification of the artefact.
Links a chat to the incident it discusses.
The type of analysis performed.
Timestamp when the communication occurred.
Inverse of hasArtefact. Links an artefact back to its incident.
Links an incident to the analyst who confirmed it as a genuine security incident.
Indicates the security event that generated this analysis
Links an artefact to the analyst who collected, created, or documented it.
Detailed description of an incident.
The actual content or value of the artefact .
Short description or name for the security event.
Links a course of action to the analyst responsible for executing it.
Links an incident to the response actions (COA) taken to resolve it.
Indicates the analyst who performed this activity
Current status of the incident.
Unique identifier for a security event.
Unique identifier for an incident.
Inverse of hasAnalysisPerformingAnalyst. Links an analyst to the analyses they performed.
Current stage in the incident lifecycle.
The data value to be analysed.
Timestamp when the specific security event activity occurred.
Inverse of prov:wasPerformedBy. Indicates an analyst performed an activity.
Links an incident to related artefacts/observables collected during the investigation.
